meanings.definition: Unable to be recovered or regained.
meanings.sent1: The lost treasure was irrecoverable, never to be found again.
meanings.sent2: The broken vase was irrecoverable, shattered into countless pieces.
meanings.sent3: The irrecoverable cookie crumbled into a million crumbs, much to the dismay of the hungry child.
meanings.sent4: Her trust in him was irrecoverable, like a fragile glass heart dropped from a great height.
meanings.sent5: The irrecoverable memories faded like footprints in the sand, washed away by the tide of time.

meanings.sent1: The irrecoverable mistake cost him his job, with no way to fix it.
meanings.sent2: The irrecoverable damage to the painting left it beyond repair.
meanings.sent3: His irrecoverable blunder at the party became the talk of the town, much to his embarrassment.
meanings.sent4: The irrecoverable error in the code crashed the entire system, like a digital avalanche.
meanings.sent5: The irrecoverable loss of the key left them locked out, with no way to enter the house.
